name: Idiopathic Mesenteric Venous Plexus Thrombosis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that worsens after eating, with nausea and bloating
treatment: transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt (TIPS) if portal hypertension develops
prognosis: Variable; depends on extent of thrombosis and response to treatment. Chronic cases may lead to portal hypertension.
description: A rare form of mesenteric venous thrombosis affecting the small venous plexuses within the mesentery without clear etiology. Presents with chronic postprandial pain due to venous congestion and ischemic bowel changes. Diagnosis requires contrast-enhanced CT or MR venography showing characteristic venous filling defects.
